items.label: prop-gevrey-regularization-cinf
items.title: Gevrey Regularization Property
items.content:
808: :label: prop-gevrey-regularization-cinf
809: 
810: If d ∈ G^s(X) for some s ≥ 1, then V_fit ∈ G^{min(s, 1)}(X). In particular:
811: - d real analytic (s < 1) → V_fit ∈ G¹
812: - d ∈ G¹ → V_fit ∈ G¹ (preserved)
813: - d ∈ G^s (s > 1) → V_fit ∈ G¹ (regularization)
814: 
815: **Interpretation**: The Gaussian localization kernel **regularizes** the measurement to at least Gevrey-1, regardless of input regularity (as long as d ∈ C∞). Analogous to heat kernel smoothing.

items.label: prop-gaussian-tail-bounds-cinf
items.title: Gaussian Tail Bounds (Conditional)
items.content:
894: :label: prop-gaussian-tail-bounds-cinf
895: 
896: Under the confining potential hypothesis (lim U = +∞), the transition density satisfies:
897: 
898: $$
899: p_t(w, w') \leq C_t \cdot \exp\left(-\frac{d(w, w')^2}{D t}\right)
900: $$
901: 
902: for constants C_t, D > 0, where d(w, w') is the hypoelliptic distance.

items.label: prop-talagrand-cinf
items.title: Talagrand Inequality (Conditional)
items.content:
916: :label: prop-talagrand-cinf
917: 
918: Assume:
919: 1. V_fit ∈ C∞ (Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-cinf-regularity`)
920: 2. V_total uniformly convex: ∇²V_total ≥ λ_Tal I
921: 3. QSD π_QSD ∝ exp(-β V_total) exists
922: 
923: Then for any ν with ν ≪ π_QSD:
924: 
925: $$
926: W_2^2(\nu, \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \leq \frac{2}{\lambda_{\text{Tal}}} D_{\text{KL}}(\nu \| \pi_{\text{QSD}})
927: $$
items.raw_directive:
913: ### 10.1. Talagrand W_2 Inequality
914: 
915: :::{prf:proposition} Talagrand Inequality (Conditional)
916: :label: prop-talagrand-cinf
917: 
918: Assume:
919: 1. V_fit ∈ C∞ (Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-cinf-regularity`)
920: 2. V_total uniformly convex: ∇²V_total ≥ λ_Tal I
921: 3. QSD π_QSD ∝ exp(-β V_total) exists
922: 
923: Then for any ν with ν ≪ π_QSD:
924: 
925: $$
926: W_2^2(\nu, \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \leq \frac{2}{\lambda_{\text{Tal}}} D_{\text{KL}}(\nu \| \pi_{\text{QSD}})
927: $$

items.label: prop-brascamp-lieb-cinf
items.title: Brascamp-Lieb Inequality (Conditional)
items.content:
947: :label: prop-brascamp-lieb-cinf
948: 
949: Under {prf:ref}`prop-talagrand-cinf` hypotheses (C∞ + uniform convexity):
950: 
951: $$
952: \text{Var}_{\pi_{\text{QSD}}}[f] \leq \frac{1}{\lambda_{\min}(\nabla^2 V_{\text{total}})} \int |\nabla f|^2 \, d\pi_{\text{QSD}}
953: $$
954: 
955: for all smooth f with π_QSD(f) = 0.
956: 
957: **Interpretation**: Optimal Poincaré constant C_Poinc = 1/λ_min, sharp for uniformly convex log-concave measures.

items.label: prop-bakry-emery-gamma2-cinf
items.title: Bakry-Émery Curvature Condition (Conditional)
items.content:
965: :label: prop-bakry-emery-gamma2-cinf
966: 
967: Assume V_fit ∈ C∞ and V_total uniformly convex with ∇²V_total ≥ λ_BE I. Then:
968: 
969: $$
970: \Gamma_2(f, f) \geq \lambda_{\text{BE}} \Gamma(f, f) \quad \forall \text{ smooth } f
971: $$
972: 
973: where:
974: - Γ(f, g) = (1/2)[L(fg) - f Lg - g Lf] = ⟨∇f, ∇g⟩ (carré du champ)
975: - Γ_2(f, f) = (1/2)[L Γ(f, f) - 2 Γ(f, Lf)] (iterated carré du champ)
976: 
977: **Implication**: Γ_2 ≥ λΓ implies:
978: - Spectral gap λ_gap ≥ λ_BE
979: - LSI with constant 1/λ_BE
980: - Hypercontractivity (Nelson's theorem)
items.raw_directive:
